intro: Filago subspicata, commonly known as the slender filago, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features slender, erect stems with small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in small, spiky heads, typical of the daisy family, and are usually yellow or pale green. Filago subspicata is adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
